experience.aboutWork:
â€¢ Developed a Full Stack exercise tracker application with React for the front-end UI and Node/Express for the back-end REST API, utilizing AWS DynamoDB for data storage. 
â€¢ Minimized manual reporting effort by ~12 hours/week and enabled direct access to critical athletics data that helped in boosting their performance by 10%. 
â€¢ Evaluated architectural strategies of the application with particular emphasis on Scalability, Usability, and Security.
â€¢ Designed visual UI elements that provided real-time feedback for the users with an SUS Usability score of 81.30. 
â€¢ Instructed Software Engineering course that emphasizes on a real-world software development in Agile Scrum to design and evaluate the software systems effectively in a team environment.

â€¢ Developed company's web application using JavaScript, React, NodeJS & MongoDB, serving over 1000 active users daily. 
â€¢ Refactored sales system from jQuery to Vue.js, reducing maintenance costs by 80% and boosting loading speed by 50%. 
â€¢ Collaborated with developers in managing 50+ servers, leading to a 30% decrease in customer complaints. 
â€¢ Optimized company's AWS cloud and utilized AWS RDS to boost international data retrieval speed by 10%.

â€¢ Identified malicious threats & resolved 80% of security issues using behavioral patterns through AI/ML algorithms. 
â€¢ Accomplished requirements to be recognized as XVigil Professional, a SaaS based digital risk monitoring platform.

projects.name: An iOS Native Mobile Application, SwiftUI - Itinerary Guide
projects.details:
â€¢ Pioneered a travel planning iOS application using Swift, AWS Lambda, API Gateway, and DynamoDB in a serverless architecture, resulting in a scalable and cost-effective solution.

â€¢ Integrated OAuth 2.0 and RESTful APIs to enable user account management, itinerary planning, and budget tracking, enhancing the travel planning process.

â€¢ Utilized agile methodologies to deliver incremental improvements, leading to a 25% increase in overall productivity.
